results.title: Chocolat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche, Cerito Films, La Sept, Alain Belmondo, Gerald Crosnier and Claire Denis
results.brief_description: Memories of a childhood in a remote part of the French Cameroons provides the basis for this subtle, partly autobiographical, portrait of a colonial society. France (a surrogate for the filmmaker), revisiting the Cameroons, flashes back to scenes of her youth when her father was a French colonial official. The precarious equilibrium of their household (the mother is attracted to a young black servant) is disturbed by the sudden arrival of a group of outsiders, both European and African, after the forced landing of their plane nearby. The sharpness of the observation and the performances - each of the outsiders represents a different perspective on Africa - prevents the film from sliding into easy nostalgia for a time and way of life long since past. Cast: Isaach de Bankole, Giulia Boschi, Francois Cluzet, Jean-Claude Adelin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warfield Productions, Dramatic Features, Albert R. Broccoli, Ken Hughes and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: The author of James Bond, Ian Fleming, wrote this charming story of a car that could fly. This is a wonderful musical/comedy fantasy for the whole family starring Dick Van Dyke and Gert Frobe. It is recreated for the screen by the director Ken Hughes of “Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines”.

results.title: Chinatown [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Long Road Productions, Robert Evans and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: Chandleresque private eye J.J. Gittes takes on the seemingly routine investigation of an errant husband but is soon caught up in a network of private and public evil. Drought-stricken Los Angeles in 1937 is a disorienting and alien place. In this multi-layered narrative, marked by dark humour, the mysterious Chinatown, where social and moral norms don’t operate, acts as a metaphor for a pervasive corruption implicating the past, the present and the future. Stars John Huston, Jack Nicholson and Faye Dunaway. Also availble on VHS [302476].

results.title: China girl
results.creator_credit: Vestron Pictures, Street Lite, Michael Nozik and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: From the opening scenes played out under the credits sequence, Abel Ferrara lays bare the central concerns of the this urban drama - the tensions that exist between Italian-Americans and Chinese-Americans. In New York the areas of Little Italy and Chinatown border one another, which means that the situation is rife for incendiary racism and violent interactions between the youths and gangs that proliferate there. Amid this chaos Tony (an Italian-American) and Tyan-Hwa (a Chinese-American) meet and fall in love, despite an overwhelming chorus of objections. Inflaming the situation are vicious territorial gang wars that erupt between various factions. Honour, traditions, ritual and loyalty are key themes elicited by Ferrara as he explores the frissons that arise when love and cultural loyalty come into conflict. There are also the difficulties that exist in relation to gender roles and the generational differences within the clans. It is Tyan-Hwa’s brother (and key gang member) who tries to control his sister’s movements and desires, much to her chagrin and frustration. This is a powerful film that ably encapsulates the violence and danger of the streets of New York. Cast includes David Caruso.

results.title: Children of the revolution
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Tristram Miall and Peter Duncan
results.brief_description: ‘Children of the Revolution’ is a delightful comedy which takes an irreverent look at political idealism. When Joan Fraser (Judy Davis), a zealous communist, visits Stalin in Moscow it’s the height of the Menzies era. She returns to Australia pregnant. Could her Stalinist love child change the course of Australian history? Wonderful performances from Judy Davis and Sam Neill (in an ironic twist on their roles in ‘My Brilliant Career’!) as well as Geoffrey Rush, Richard Roxburgh, Rachel Griffiths and F. Murray Abraham as Stalin.

results.title: Children of paradise = Les Enfants du paradis
results.creator_credit: Societe Nouvelle Pathe Cinema, Raymond Borderie and Marcel Carne
results.brief_description: The film begins with the titles superimposed on a theatre curtain which, when it lifts, ushers us into the chaotic world of the “boulevard of crime” in the mid-nineteenth century. Mime artist Baptiste (Jean-Louis Barrault) is desperately in love with the beautiful Garance (Arletty), but she is too world-weary and cynical to believe in his romantic notions of love; instead she begins an affair with the vain actor, Frederick, who dreams of leaving the pantomimes and performing Shakespeare in the grand theatres of Paris. This magical movie, consistently voted the best French film of all time, is a celebration of art and love. While behind the scenes the actors all battle with the bitter realities of unrequited desire or betrayed trust, on stage, performing to the “children of paradise” (those too poor to afford seats in the stalls and so have to sit in the “Gods”), they transform their sadness into the magic of dreams. It is as if, in this film, Marcel Carne makes good on all the promises of film and theatre to create a truly popular art, and he does so by celebrating not only the lives of the actors and performers on the “boulevard”, but also by celebrating the dreams and desires of the raucous, struggling audience that fills the “gods”. In the bond between performer and audience we see reflected the pleasures and mistakes of love itself. The sophisticated screenplay is by Jacques Prevert. Considered one of the cinema’s supreme works of art, the film was partly secretly filmed while Paris was still under Nazi occupation. On all levels, a labour of immense love. Cast also includes Maria Casares and Pierre Renoir. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Children of a lesser god
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Burt Sugarman, Patrick Palmer and Randa Haines
results.brief_description: Based on Mark Medoff’s Tony Award-winning (1980) play. It is a touching and poignant love story between a deaf woman and a hearing man. William Hurt gives a sensitive performance as James a likeable schoolmaster, whose job is to teach hearing impaired people to speak. Sarah (Marlee Matlin - who is hearing impaired in real life) is a young beautiful girl who leaves school with a chip on her shoulder and with the knowledge that sex needs no conversation. The touching portrayal of their attraction makes it impossible not to share the experience. Matlin won the 1987 Academy Award for Best Actress with nominations for Best Picture, Best Actor, Best Supporting Actress and Best Adapted Screenplay.

results.title: Chicago
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Martin Richards and Rob Marshall
results.brief_description: A dazzling spectacle that glides between the intrigue of rivalry and betrayal to sensational fantasies of music and dance! At a time when crimes of passion result in celebrity headlines, nightclub sensation Velma Kelley and spotlight-seeking Roxie Hart find themselves sharing space on Chicago’s famed Murderess Row. Velma and Roxie will stop at nothing to outdo each other in their obsessive pursuit of fame and celebrity. Stars Rene Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere with Queen Latifah, John C. Reilly, Lucy Liu. Dion Beebe is director of photography. Based on the musical play Chicago, directed and choreographed for the stage by Bob Fosse; based on the play by Maurine Dallas Watkins. (Awards: Winner of several awards including Winner of 2003 Academy Awards for Best Motion Picture of the Year; Winner of 2003 BAFTA Film Awards for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role: Catherine Zeta-Jones; Winner of 2003 Golden Globes Awards for Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy)

results.title: Chasing Amy [DVD]
results.creator_credit: View Askew Productions, Miramax Films, Scott Mosier and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: The concluding chapter of Kevin Smith’s New Jersey Trilogy, “Chasing Amy” is a comedy about Holden, a successful comic-book creator, whose life takes a turn when he falls madly in love with Alyssa, a fellow artist. The first major shock awaiting Holden is Alyssa’s apparent lesbian orientation. The second one comes after the two develop a strong friendship, and Alyssa decides not to limit her chances of love to women only. The two begin an affair, despite Holden’s nagging doubts about her promiscuous past. Cast includes Ben Affleck, Joey Lauren Adams, Jason Lee, Dwight Ewell, Jason Mewes and Kevin Smith.
